intro: Spermodon curvulus, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent corona. Spermodon curvulus produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in its family.
